description:
A dream of falling from the sky... and then birth. Rakka is born from a large cocoon into the Old Home, greeted by a group of girls with small wings on their backs and shining halos above their heads. Soon Rakka’s own wings grow, a halo is placed on her head and she is told that she must work in the nearby town of Grie. She soon realizes that the town and the entire world they live in are confined behind the Wall, a tall, impenetrable wall that none except the mysterious Toga are allowed to exit.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Une fille qui a des ailes grises

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

node.description: [Profile](http://www.sound-wing.co.jp/sioya.html)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/abfly) | [Blog](https://abflyblog.wordpress.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/abfly/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/abflygm)

A graphic artist who works predominantly in anime and manga.

He first gained fame in his work on the avant-garde anime [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/). He is also responsible for the concept and character design for the series [NieA_7](https://anilist.co/anime/800/). He is the creator of the doujinshi Haibane Renmei, which was also adapted into [an anime](https://anilist.co/anime/387/).

He first began his career as a teen in Tokyo, being initially recognized as a graffiti artist who regularly got into legal problems with his art. His concepts for all his later works are said to be inspired by this time of his life and has projected a dark theme into his anime character designs. He is also a colleague and friend of [Chiaki J. Konaka](https://anilist.co/staff/101160/), with whom he collaborated on both Serial Experiments Lain and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/).

Endorses "ABe" as romaji spelling of his surname.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/abfly) | [Blog](https://abflyblog.wordpress.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/abfly/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/abflygm)

A graphic artist who works predominantly in anime and manga.

He first gained fame in his work on the avant-garde anime [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/). He is also responsible for the concept and character design for the series [NieA_7](https://anilist.co/anime/800/). He is the creator of the doujinshi Haibane Renmei, which was also adapted into [an anime](https://anilist.co/anime/387/).

He first began his career as a teen in Tokyo, being initially recognized as a graffiti artist who regularly got into legal problems with his art. His concepts for all his later works are said to be inspired by this time of his life and has projected a dark theme into his anime character designs. He is also a colleague and friend of [Chiaki J. Konaka](https://anilist.co/staff/101160/), with whom he collaborated on both Serial Experiments Lain and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/).

Endorses "ABe" as romaji spelling of his surname.

[Profile](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/9) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kowotani)

After graduating from university, he became a founding member of Yuji Saito's music production company IMAGINE in November 1986. The company has grown to feature musicians like Kohei Tanaka, Shiro Hamaguchi, Hayato Matsuo, and Shinji Miyazaki, who have become well known for cinematic scoring and orchestration through Otani. 

In 1987, he made his debut as an anime composer with the popular manga adaptation City Hunter, which earned him recognition in the industry. He later went on to work on titles such as Spy Games (1988), The Ultimate Teacher (1988), The Yadamura Waltz (1988), and You're Under Arrest (1994). The anime Future GPX Cyber Formula (1991) and Mobile Suit Gundam Wing (1995) and several films in the Gamera series are some of his most well-known works.  In 2001, he created the score to the film Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack. Other notable scores by Otani include Outlaw Star (1998), Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz (1998), Cross Fire (2000), The SoulTaker (2001), Haibane Renmei (2002), Zatch Bell! (2003), Eyeshield 21 (2005), Pumpkin Scissors (2006), Deltora Quest (2007), and Over Drive (2007). He has also been the music director and keyboardist of the band Dreams Come True. He appeared at Eminence Symphony Orchestra's events A Night in Fantasia 2007: Symphonic Games Edition and Unearthing Eden ~The sounds of AINARU~ in 2007.  

Throughout his career, Otani has also composed music for several video games, making his debut with the 1995 shooter game Philosoma. In 2000, he created the soundtrack to the flight simulator Sky Odyssey. He scored Shadow of the Colossus in 2005, his most famous video game work. Otani was responsible for composing the music for Wild Arms: Twilight Venom (2000), an anime adaptation of the Wild Arms video game series; he also arranged compositions of Michiko Naruke's music from the series. He did two more video game to anime adaptations: Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge (1997) and Popolocrois Monogatari (1998). In 2005, he created the track "Madness" alongside Hiroko Shigezumi for the Square Enix game Heavy Metal Thunder.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松本憲生)

Originating from Tatsunoko's animators training institute, where he met [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/). Though primarily an action animator, he’s demonstrated impressive range elsewhere like in his scenes for [Haibane Renmei](https://anilist.co/anime/387/) and [Kaguya-hime](https://anilist.co/anime/16664/). He has the reputation of a fast and disciplined worker. [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) said that he must have a “secret” for producing such a large volume of superb cuts.

Though one of his earliest assignments was as an in-betweens checker for [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/), his first major job was on [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), working under the director of the series, [Kazuhiro Furuhashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100655/). He would collaborate with Furuhashi again on Rurouni Kenshin, [You’re Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/), and [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/). Around this time Matsumoto was also mentored by [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/) on [Irresponsible Captain Tylor](https://anilist.co/anime/569/).

Matsumoto’s character animation is loose and full of smears, often looking like featureless masses in individual frames. He draws smoke without highlights, a tendency that earned the nickname “Norio smoke” and has been imitated by animators like [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/). He occasionally storyboards his own scenes as he did for the 12th episode of [Birdy Decode:02](https://anilist.co/anime/5074/), the [third Naruto movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2144/), and episodes 31 & 85 of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/anime/45/). Prefers battles that take place in wide-open spaces with lots of forward momentum and background movement. Influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) and [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/), and has adapted elements of their approach for a wider audience.

Whenever he serves as animation director on an episode, he does a lot of the key animation work himself. He also soloed the 7th episode of [Eat-Man](https://anilist.co/anime/1704/) and the [Kuragehime](https://anilist.co/anime/8129/) ED. He failed attempting to solo the 39th episode of You’re Under Arrest, and requested his name not be on the telop despite animating the vast majority of the episode.

Famous for his work on the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise, in which he often collaborated with Atsushi Wakabayashi.

As a well known animator with a wide network of connections, he regularly helps and receives help from his friends.

(Source: Animators Wiki)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%AD%E3%81%8E%E3%81%97%E3%81%B2%E3%82%8D%E3%81%97)

Hiroshi Negishi is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%AD%E3%81%8E%E3%81%97%E3%81%B2%E3%82%8D%E3%81%97)

Hiroshi Negishi is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.
